Posted By: LordWalter (11/28/2012 3:41:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Maybe I'm blind, but... This ain't bad, but it doesN't seem that good to me either. Let's have a closer look  
  
Stats: by itself, it's a 5/3. At common, you get a 5/5 for that amount of mana. And it has no trample nor hexproof nor regeneration nor anything else.  
Token: it gives you a 3/3 when it dies. And it's likely to die with just 3 toughness for five mana. And sure, a 3/3 token is cute, but it's not great either.  
  
And the five life? They make no sense. They are nice too, but this guy wants to be played in an aggressive deck obviously. What with high power, low toughness, and token when he dies. And lifegain is unnecessary in an aggressive deck.  
  
If I'd want a guy that gives me a token, I'd rather play a penumbra wurm. Sure, costs a bit more, but there is a huge difference between a 6/6 trampler that gives me a 6/6 trampling token, and this dude.  
  
I give him a 3/5. He's ok, but... not that great. Even flavorlike I don't get the lifegain. It seems so random.

Token: it gives you a 3/3 when it dies. And it's likely to die with just 3 toughness for five mana. And sure, a 3/3 token is cute, but it's not great either.

And the five life? They make no sense. They are nice too, but this guy wants to be played in an aggressive deck obviously. What with high power, low toughness, and token when he dies. And lifegain is unnecessary in an aggressive deck.

If I'd want a guy that gives me a token, I'd rather play a penumbra wurm. Sure, costs a bit more, but there is a huge difference between a 6/6 trampler that gives me a 6/6 trampling token, and this dude.

posts.post_content:
I hate this card. Every standard deck has green now just for this card. I believe that's pretty much the definition of broken. On it's own it's overpowered. With everything else they printed around it, it's absurdly broken. Maybe if it was less splashable it'd be okay, but with only one colored mana it just ends up in every single deck.  
  
0.5/5 for making standard not fun

posts.post_content:
I think they specifically made this a "leaves the Battlefield" trigger rather than a "dies" trigger so that it would interact well with [Worldfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldfire). As it is, the rather obscure and borderline unplayable [Walker of the Grove](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Walker of the Grove) is the only other card that does anything similar, and there's no other clear reason for them having done it.  
  
I'm not complaining, though! I love it.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Overpowered creature... The are a few creatures that can counter it and it's baby token, like:  
[Abbatoir Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abbatoir Ghoul).  
[Carnival Hellsteed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnival Hellsteed).  
[Village Ironsmith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Village Ironsmith) (transformed in [Ironfang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ironfang)).  
[Kessig Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kessig Wolf) (paying it's ability).  
[Minotaur Aggressor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Minotaur Aggressor).  
[Odric, Master Tactician](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Odric, Master Tactician).  
[Rakdos Ringleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos Ringleader).  
[Silverclaw Griffin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silverclaw Griffin).  
  
To use it more correctly, give it [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor), [Cloudshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudshift), [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel), even use a [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon) if you want to save it from [Murder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murder) or the like

Posted By: Wizpal (11/9/2012 6:16:17 PM)

posts.post_content:
I have one massive problem with Thragtusk.   
  
The problem isn't how horrendously bad or overpowered he is. He's a really good creature for a 5-drop without being an unstoppable monster, so I would say that he's pretty balanced.  
  
No, my problem is that he's good, but **not 25 f\*\*\*ing dollars good.** There is no way in hell that a playset of Thragtusk is legitimately worth $100, especially not when there are other cards that are potentially better than him who are collecting dust in your local shop's $1 rare box.

Posted By: Continue (2/21/2013 9:42:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think this card is much better for it's format than it is for it's card. It's an average beater with a lifegain tacked on (a nice bonus) and a small beater left over for you. It's true that flicker effects can add up on him and really flip a game, but I'm unsure that 5 life + 3/3 for a card, even if that card is cheap is that mind-bogglingly good. It's good for sure! But.. I think it has more to do with it's standard environment.   
  
JMS is brutal in \*any\* environment, and one could say the same for Baneslayer.   
  
That said, they have printed a clear response to him: [Boros Reckoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Reckoner)  
You get your choice of killing him without problem, killing him and hitting the opponent for 5 (countering the life gain) or possibly other options.   
  
I wish I could give a 4.3, I'll go with 4.5?
posts.html:

Posted By: steinburger1109 (2/13/2013 8:03:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Thragtusk is a great card, not just because it's strong, but because when this is the defining card in standard, the format is actually in good shape.  
  
Just remember what standard looked like in previous years...  
  
Lorwyn/Alara - faeries. Imagine playing against tempo except even worse.  
Alara/Zendikar - jund. Bloodbraid elf into blightning ggwp  
Zendikar/Scars - cawblade. The first standard bannings in years, nuff said.  
Scars/Innistrad - Delver. Get bashed with 3/2 fliers for 1 mana while all your spells get mana leaked and creatures get vapor snagged.  
  
Would you rather have one of these formats, or a 5 mana creature that stalls the game out?
posts.html:

Posted By: BlueBodies (2/1/2013 2:43:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
My only gripe about this card is that it's brainlessly good. You don't need to build around it, it's not weak to any specific deck, it doesn't clash with any type of deck, it's easily splashable, and doesn't even fully die to [doom blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doom blade).  
Hell, casting a single board wipe after this guy his the battle field is a surefire way to ruin your opponents day.  
As powerful as this card is with the current format, they really need to restrict this to a "two of" for decks. I guarantee it would make the format more diverse.
